page.title: 12RELIGION-BUTTERTON.
page.content: Rev:T Houghton showed us round the church.St Thomas' Church in the parish of Newcastle, is named after Thomas the Apostle. It is built in sandstone. Inside, the walls are plain white, with only a few memorials. The biggest ones are the Swinnerton/Pilkington family ones who died in 1854 and 1855.They built the church and are buried underneath it. There is no cemetery; the water level is too high.There is a crucifixion picture rescued from the vault of Butterton Hall.There is one bell but the rope is broken. Under the memorials are box pews,where the Lord of the manor and his servants sat. The church banner is on the wall.About 30 people attend services weekly.The alter vases are Brass. Most of the books are in the record office, but we saw the original marriage book.
